question: when did the cable bridge in hydrabad built/
answer: The Cable-stayed bridge in Hyderabad, India, is the Peddapuram-Rajahmundry Bridge, also known as the Indra Venkateshwara Bridge. Construction on this bridge began in 2013 and it was officially inaugurated in August 2019. However, the bridge became operational for public use only in December 2019. So, the exact date of its building can be said to be from 2013 to 2019.
